section.title: Changes to Build Requirements
section.para: Additional build requirements have been added, and some build options have switched defaults. This section lists those changes.

formalpara.title: New Build Requirement: gperf
formalpara.para: GNU's gperf builds a so-called perfect hash for a defined set of strings. As such, it provides functionality similar to lex or yacc for fast parsing.

section.title: New Features in 2.5
section.para: The following are new features in Cyrus IMAP 2.5.

section.title: Automatic Creation of Mailboxes
section.para: We have incorporated the functionality of the long standing and commonly applied autocreate patch, previously developed and maintained by the University of Athens, Greece.

With this functionality, a user's INBOX or personal mailbox can be created automatically, in the event a message is to be posted to such folder, and/or on user login, with quota automatically set for the new user, amongst others.
With this patch is included, the ability to;

listitem.para: automatically create user INBOX and personal folders,
automatically create a configured series of folders, such as 'Trash', 'Sent', 'Drafts', as per the configuration.
automatically subscribe users to a configured list of folders,
automatically subscribe the user to all folders the user has the appropriate permissions on.

section.title: Improvements to Development and Quality Assurance Processes
Unit Testing with CUnit
section.para: The Cyrus IMAP 2.5 series is the first release that employs Unit testing, assuring improved code quality enabling faster and more significant changes to the code then ever before. As such, feature enhancements and other developments can be tested more thoroughly before being handed over to the community for testing and Quality Assurance, improving the product to be tested.

section.title: Continuous Integration
section.para: The employment of the Hudson continuous integration suite enables us to build and, in combination with the CUnit test suite, run tests on a multitude of platforms contributed to the project by people from all over the world.
